resources.string:
Mesh mode allows the devices to connect to each other forming a distributed network which does not have a central control point. This allows for bigger networks and does not require hotspots.

To activate mesh mode, open the settings screen and then on the network settings page click on Mesh Mode.

Mesh mode requires the device to support IBSS WiFi and also requires root permission.

The other mode of operation is to connect to a normal wifi hotspot (It can be created on the device or externally). Select one of the existing hotspot configurations on the network settings screen or connect to an existing hotspot to use this mode of operation.
Here you will see all the phones that are on your network. From here you can easily call them or send a message. You can also save the peers in your android contacts.

The main view is where you will see all the other phones on your network running this application.\n\nIf you see no other devices please follow the trouble shooting guide in the help section. Use the menu or action bar to configure the application or to get help.

Please make sure you understand the two network modes by reading the network mode help.\n\nThen make sure that you are connected to the correct network. Also make sure that the Android Walkie Mesh service is running by checking to see if the Walkie Mesh icon is in the android notification tray.
